comments.commentBody:
The King's Equal by Katherine Patterson -- ages 6-10
Weaving of a Dream by Marilee Heyer -- ages 7-11
Fearless Girls, Wise Women & Beloved Sisters: Heroines in Folktales from Around the World by Kathleen Ragan. This is an anthology that can be read (and modified) by parents to kids.

OMG, why are *princesses* always the reference point?? These books don't liberate girls from the princess stranglehold; at best they defy it, and in fact it sounds as if "play with" it is a more accurate description.

As an unreconstructed-and-proud tomboy (and mom to two boys), I've been delighted to see that there are still plenty of real-live tomboys among my sons' female friends and classmates. Corporations like Disney -- and media like this blog -- would seem to have us believe the tomboy species had gone extinct.

So here are some great books for girls that have nothing to do with princesses (and which are also great for boys):

Swallows and Amazons (and the other 12 books in the series)

The Greene Poodles

Pippi Longstocking (many books in the series)

Heidi

Little Women (I know, except for the end -- tell them they're free to ignore that part)

Nancy Drew mysteries

The Bridge to Terabithia

To Kill a Mockingbird

That's just off the top of my head, I'm sure there are many others.

I also encourage parents of prissy girls (I won't use the terms "girly," "girly-girl," "feminine," "femmy" etc. because prissiness has nothing to do with being a "girl" or "female" -- i.e., having two X chromosomes, a uterus, etc. -- and the terms therefore contain the implicit assertion that female gender roles are biologically determined rather than the social constructs they are) to get their daughters involved in skiing, especially downhill. As a group, skier girls (just as they were when I was a kid) continue to be very down-to-earth about things like hair, nails and make-up, since skiing tends to mess all that up, but for a great reason -- it's fun! -- that kids can immediately recognize on a gut level. But skier girls also tend to go for a very pretty look that will be appealing even to prissy girls. (Plus, in my experience, parents gain street cred with their kids when they take them skiing, lasting into the teen years and beyond, so that they won't tune you out when you talk to them about drugs, etc.)

And I recommend Japanese anime, which typically features strong female protagonists (and is enjoyed by boys and girls alike). *Any* of the children's films of Hayao Miyazaki, especially "Spirited Away," "Kiki's Delivery Service" or "My Neighbor Totoro," will include a great role model for girls and is a great place to start. (But note that his "Princess Mononoke" is for adults and has a good bit of violence.)

Terry Pratchett's Tiffany Aching novels (The Wee Free Men, A Hat Full of Sky, Wintersmith, I Shall Wear Midnight) are awesome. Tiffany is a witch, not a princess, but she is an exceptionally strong female character- fulfilling traditional female roles (caring for others) while still kicking butt. Maybe for a bit older reader- say, 10?
OMG, is he really going to run for re-election on a platform of solar panels and electric trains?
We should start calling it the job killing, illegal health care bill...
The Prez prays for peace--I pray for the families of the men and women coming home in boxes at Dover A.F.B. and those waiting for artifical limbs at Walter Reade.
And just what was this Wallace doofus doing at the breakfast?   Whose idea was that?  A piano-playing pig named Pigerace?  There goes the highbrow vote.

Tell it like it is.  The woman is stupid, but she's wise enough to know she's not up to the intellectual level of those in attendance.  She wouldn't be able to keep up, and she knows it.  I think she's a lot of fun to watch, and I'm sorry not to see her make a fool of herself yet again.

The Philadelphia Yard is one of the greatest homes for pork in the entire US. Here's a report from CNN about a previous project:

And in 1997 Pennsylvania gave $307 million in economic incentives to Kvaerner ASA, a Norwegian global engineering and construction company, to open a shipyard at the former Philadelphia Naval Shipyard and employ 950 people. Subsidy: $323,000 for each job.

For the last two years, EVERONE has been adjusting to the constraints imposed by the past 30 years of total dereliction of vigilance against the triumph of Gresham's Law. The bad really did drive out the good.
Our rulers assure us that prayer WILL avail as the climate extremes one expects from the rise of heat-concentrating gases in the atmosphere create famines and mass migrations, NachoHomey.

#119: "[...]socialistic country like France, Spain, and other failed countries in Europe."

Calling European countries "socialistic" or even throwing them together with the former Soviet Union (in another comment) shows a lack of knowledge regarding socialism. Germany is proud to be a "social democracy", so forget about your "socialism". We are just as capitalistic as the USA.

There is no Honor in the continued persecution of those whose only crime was to be themselves and Loved to serve their Country at the same time.

DADT was unfair to those soldiers of an alternate sexual orientation and to still apply the less-than-Honorable status to their dischage, when they were found not compliant to DADT then and now after DADT's repeal, is the same as when Black people were still denied their rights as Americans after being freed from Slavery in the 19th and 20th Century.

It is a shame on our Country that a bottle of hooch gets more respect after the repeal of Prohibition than a Human Being, who honorably served their Country, after the repeal of Don't-Ask-Don't-Tell.

#10 Gthornthon

You neglected to mention #1 in crack labs in Alaska.
And don't forget those 120million in Federal Pork dollars that Sarah received!!!! What does that come to?....a million per citizen?

Hey-wait a minute- if she can get that kind of dough for her little town-what could she get for me?
I would like a million dollars.

Nice pandering Mr Obama...That should work.
Just don't pray too many times in a day or Glenn Beck will accuse you of being a muslim.
Or has he already?

MA must be so proud to have such a wonderful statesman like this.

Any man who can run a male escort brothel out of his apartment and survive politically all these years must be a genius...either that or a Democrat.

Of course, the Republicans will denounce this as "the government trying to pick winners."

As opposed to their common-sense approach of lavishing ever greater tax breaks on already existing winners.

You know--like the $156 million tax refund Exxon Mobil got last year, to help sustain them in a lean year where they only $19 BILLION in PROFITS.

Really, it is just common sense.

Try to pick winners--and there's a chance some still won't win.

Existing winners--sure bets.

And big donors.

There's a new poll showing President Obama beating Sarah "Half-Term" Palin in red-state Arizona 49% - 41%. Moderates break 68% for President Obama and 21% for Palin. President Obama wins all age groups, with biggest margin among 18-29 & 65+. Hispanics back President Obama over Palin, 52% - 38%. The vote among whites though is close, with 46% for President Obama and 44% for Palin.
Believe it when you see the investment check and you see the investment in production and US jobs otherwise this is just more change we can't believe in. Talk is cheap.
Gee, at the so-called National Prayer Breakfast did they really have to show a film clip of anti-semite Mel Gibson.
Ugh, quit giving press coverage to this half wit.

KimMT,

You need to read a history book. (Hint: the Bible is not a history book). have you ever heard of the U.S. Treaty with Tipoli? It was authored by American diplomat Joel Barlow in 1796. It was sent to the floor of the Senate, June 7, 1797, where it was read aloud in its entirety and unanimously approved. John Adams, having seen the treaty, signed it and proudly proclaimed it to the Nation. Let me quote from Article 11:

"As the Government of the United States of America is not, in any sense, founded on the Christian religion; as it has in itself no character of enmity against the laws, religion, or tranquillity, of Mussulmen; and, as the said States never entered into any war, or act of hostility against any Mahometan nation, it is declared by the parties, that no pretext arising from religious opinions, shall ever produce an interruption of the harmony existing between the two countries."

Of course you never heard of that. You also probably didn't know that of all the founding fathers, only John Adams considered himself to be a Christian? Washington, Franklin, Hamilton, Jefferson, Madison, Mason...none of them considered themselves to be Christians. But you didn't know that either because you don't read books other than those written by Gideon, King James, Ann Coulter and Glenn Beck.

Sad for you.

While Republicans were busy denying health insurance to 51 million Americans they were also ignoring the 10% unemployed and the 16% living in poverty. What a proud moment for the GOP. Where are the jobs Senator McConnell and Speaker Boehner.

To appeal to average Americans, you often have to look stupid.

That's why it takes a certain brand of depravity to rise to national prominence in the political sphere.
President Obama will once again win  PA in his successful re-election to a Second Term in 2012.
